meanings.definition: A person who delivers a speech or oration.
meanings.sent1: The orators at the event captivated the audience with their powerful speeches.
meanings.sent2: The orators at the debate competition were well-prepared and confident.
meanings.sent3: The orators decided to have a friendly competition to see who could speak the longest without taking a breath.
meanings.sent4: The orators' words were like music to the ears of the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The orators stood tall on the stage, commanding attention with their words.

meanings.sent1: The young student quickly became known as one of the best orators in the school.
meanings.sent2: The orators at the conference impressed the audience with their eloquence.
meanings.sent3: The orators decided to have a friendly competition to see who could speak the fastest without stumbling over words.
meanings.sent4: The orators' voices echoed through the hall, leaving a lasting impact on the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The orators' gestures and expressions added depth to their speeches.
